required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Growth Factor Effect on Split-thickness Donor Site Healing: a Comparison of Adipose Tissue Extract and PRP
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Adipose Tissue Extract and PRP on Slpit-thickness Donor Site Wound Healing. A Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: Adipose Tissue Extract (ATE) has been found to be an antologous source of growth factors with proven in vitro angiogenic and adipogenic properties.It is obtained by a simple lipoaspiration procedure. We sought to compare the effect of ATE with another known source, platelet-rich plasma to compare the wound healing characteristics on skin graft donor sites.

detailed_description.textblock: We enrolled 24 patients with and indication for skin graft. Two or more split-thickness grafts we taken per patient, one serving as control and the other as experimental. The experimenatl sites were covered with either autologous PRP or ATE prepared in the OR, which was selected in an unblinded manner due to surgical theater conveniece. However, donor sites were randomized through a computer generator. Covered with a semioclusive film, wound were separated and followed up on days 3,5,7,10,14 for wound healing and 30 and 60 for scar evaluation. Digital spectophotocutometry was applied to know the hemoglobin and melanin content of the wounds, and software was applied to know the rate of wound re-epithelization.

primary_outcome.description: observational-digital photogrpahy with specializaed custom-made software

clinical_study.condition: Wound Healing, Adipose Tissue Extract, Plateelt Rich Plasma, Skin Graft Donor Site

intervention.description: Adipose tissue extract is obtained on site with lipoaspirate adipose tissue prepared though incubation and filtration
Autologous platelet rich plasma is obtained onsite and activated following commercial kit instructions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- donor site indication
Exclusion Criteria:
- immunosupressive states
- terminal renal insufficiency
- pregnancy
- coagulation discrasias
- active infection in donor site

results_reference.citation: Sarkanen JR, Kaila V, Mannerström B, Räty S, Kuokkanen H, Miettinen S, Ylikomi T. Human adipose tissue extract induces angiogenesis and adipogenesis in vitro. Tissue Eng Part A. 2012 Jan;18(1-2):17-25. doi: 10.1089/ten.TEA.2010.0712. Epub 2011 Oct 4.

Sarkanen JR, Ruusuvuori P, Kuokkanen H, Paavonen T, Ylikomi T. Bioactive acellular implant induces angiogenesis and adipogenesis and sustained soft tissue restoration in vivo. Tissue Eng Part A. 2012 Dec;18(23-24):2568-80. doi: 10.1089/ten.TEA.2011.0724. Epub 2012 Aug 17.
